Based on the search results, I found several Robinson Crusoe TV series and animated adaptations, including BBC productions and children's shows. Here's what I discovered:

## Key Robinson Crusoe TV Series and Adaptations:

### The Adventures of Robinson Crusoe (1964)
The Adventures of Robinson Crusoe (French: Les Aventures de Robinson Crusoë) is a French-German children's television drama series made by Franco London Films and based on Daniel Defoe's 1719 novel Robinson Crusoe.(no content)The show was first aired in Germany in October 1964 as four 90-minute episodes and was first aired in the UK in 1965 as a 13-part serial.(no content)The English-language version's theme music, which the BBC requested before they would buy the serial, has been praised.(no content)After its debut in 1965 it became a staple part of the BBC's school summer holiday schedules and was last screened in the early 1980s, after which the BBC's contract for repeat screenings expired.

### Crusoe (2008-2009)
Crusoe is an adventure-drama television series, based loosely on the 1719 novel Robinson Crusoe by Daniel Defoe. The series' 13 episodes aired on NBC from October 17, 2008, to January 31, 2009.(no content)In the UK, Crusoe premiered with a double-bill on FTA Terrestrial Channel Five on 20 December 2008 and was then played daily during the holiday period for the full 13 episodes.

### Animated Adaptations
In 1981, Czechoslovakian director and animator Stanislav Látal made a version of the story under the name Adventures of Robinson Crusoe, a Sailor from York combining traditional and stop-motion animation. The movie was coproduced by regional West Germany broadcaster Südwestfunk Baden-Baden.(no content)In 1988, an animated cartoon for children called Classic Adventure Stories Robinson Crusoe was released.

### BBC Audio Productions
The search results also show The BBC Children's Classics are all excellent audio dramatizations with top-notch actors, sound effects and music. This includes a BBC radio dramatization of Robinson Crusoe that was first broadcast on Radio 4 in May 1998.

### Cast Away Connection
The 2000 film Cast Away, with Tom Hanks as a FedEx employee stranded on an island for many years, also borrows much from the Robinson Crusoe story.

The most famous and beloved adaptation appears to be the 1964 French-German production that became a BBC staple for children's television programming, running regularly during school holidays for about 15 years.
